appDescription.message: Automatically block anyone with specific keywords in their Twitter bio.

blockedWords.message: List all your trigger words (separate by comma):

allowedWords.message: Don't flag when these are present (separate by comma):

intro_text.message: DoucheBlock blocks people who use specific keywords in their Twitter bio. Specify your choice of keywords below, then you are ready to use DoucheBlock.

blockCount.message: This extension has blocked $count$ douches for you.

log_empty.message:
This log is currently empty.
Don't worry, it will build automatically over time.

log_intro.message: This log includes up to $count$ most recent blocks performed by DoucheBlock.

configuring_words.message:
Configuring trigger keywords

  • Separate each word, word pair, or expression by a comma; they will be evaluated individually against bios
  • Keyword match is case-insensitive — abc matches AbC aBC ...etc.
  • You can use emojis as blocking keywords 🥲
  • Regex patterns are supported: here is a cheat sheet
  • IMPORTANT: when regex contains backslashes, you must escape them - example: \b should be written as \\b
  • Occurrence of a keyword anywhere in the bio counts as match (substring match) - specify regex word boundary to match by whole words
  • Keyword evaluation priority is the same as order of words in keyword list

whitelist_help.message:
Whitelisting

When using "confirm before blocking" mode, if you choose not to block someone when alerted by choosing "cancel", that handle will be added to a whitelist. You will not receive further alerts about that handle. You can still always block that user later on twitter.

When using automatic blocking mode, whitelist does not apply.
